content: My husband found out the other day that he is pre diabetic. Is there any advice you can give me to tell him to do and not do? Thank you

What do you take metformin with so it doesn’t leave horrible taste on your tongue?What do you take metformin with so it doesn’t leave horrible taste on your tongue?

I usually don’t put extra salt on my food when I cook. But I do when I cook salmon. I think I over did it cuz now I feel like 🤮 I ate lemon and drank lemon water but it’s not helping. Any suggestions?
A1c is an 11 again I’m so disappointed in myself.
Does anyone use cinnamon to help keep their blood sugar levels under control? I do.

I have been on Metormin for years.  I eat too many carbs and I decided to eat healthier and lower my carbs.  I ate mostly vegetables today and got sicker than a dog with stomach distress and diarrhea.  It brought back my irritable bowel syndrom.  I am sad.

Another fast way to get your blood sugar levels under control is excercises after my meal my bs was114 which is normal but I walked down 5 flights of stairs and walk around for 10 more minutes my blood was 99. Dancing is excercise good for keeping blood sugar under control.

Feeling so discouraged I eat right, I look like a pin hole cushion already but my numbers are just not going down.....I even gave up coffee and just drinking green tea, there's always lemon and cucumber in my water... I just don't know anymore last night I took medication and this morning it was exactly the same.. I'm venting out loud and don't know what else to change.... I don't exercise daily but have about a 20min walk around the block

Hi everyone.  I was taking gabapentin for the nerve damage pain for the last 9 months and finally STOPPED taking it. It did not help much but I would end up vomiting every few weeks.   I also was put on doxycycline antibiotics for an ulcer on my toe that I have. It’s taking forever to heal. Been going to Podiatrist. The doxycycline is ALSO making my stomach ache so bad and making me gag and vomit.  STOPPED THE DOXYCYCLINE NOW after telling Doc.  How can I make my stomach feel better??   The neuropathy hurts so bad in my legs but it’s my stomach that’s worse.  I did however get an ultrasound for my cold legs today and heard my heartbeat while it was being done. Hope that’s a good sign.  I’m so lost here.  I have been on metformin and a BP med amlodipine since diagnosis a year ago.  Any thoughts other than warm mint tea, tagament and chewable pepto for vomiting? I want to go into my hot tub so badly for neuropathy but Podiatrist says no because toe ulcer is not completely healed. Thank you so much for any help.

Put on a new libre sensor last night, pulled out the applicator and blood was every where. In the applicator, on the sensor and pouring down from the sensor. What the heck?  Has anyone else ever had it do that, I'm just curious. Thanks

So there was a huge fiasco with my Victoza prescription... long story short, my doctor sucks and now I have missed 3 doses of my Victoza!  I know this group is not a place for medical advice, but the Victoza company says if you miss 3 or more doses, contact your doctor to see how to start it back up... my doctor is IMPOSSIBLE to get a hold of. Anyone miss 3 or more doses, and if so, what method did you use to start it back up?
This is for type 1 diabetes people

Is anyone having problems with freestyle libre coming off your arm? I started using it a month ago and this is the 2nd it comes off. I was on the treadmill and sweating then I noticed half of it was coming off and ended up coming off, I’m paying for this out of pocket but yet love this libre.. Very discouraged at the moment 😞

Found a cereal that is low carb and no added sugar. Found it at Costco in San Dimas, Ca. It has been one of the tastiest￼ low carb cereal I have eaten so far. BS before breakfast was 142, two hours after breakfast BS was 121. I also had a slice of Dave’s Killer bread with NuttZo peanut butter, coffee with coconut Cream.

Life isnt fair. This is my belly before & after on the same day from my Inflammatory Bowel disease ulcerative colitis(autoimmune)... I hadn't had a bowel movement 💩for 4 days!!!😪🤢 I also have type 1 diabetes & Epilepsy since 1994, (26yrs)& depression & anxiety & my ssdi lawyer couldn't approve me after 3 denies/appeals and 4yrs w no job!!! I'm in a Republican state(UTAH) & am SO nervous bc now all I'm waiting on is a federal court case... ugh!! They told me the judge didn't believe me!🤬 WWYD? Has any1 else gone through this??? Why does every1 else get approved but with Way less?!?!

If you keep your blood sugar levels at 160 and above for a long period of time that's when diabetes can attack any part of your body in a mean way. Let's watch our blood sugar levels as often as possible.

I wondering if people are throwing up with type 2 insulin dependent? I take 2000mg of metformin twice a day, trajenta (linagliptin)5 mg 10 units of Lantus at night time & raperazole for my stomach and acid reflux 20mg once a day? It’s a terrible feeling puking all hours or when I wake up Thanks in advance
I have been having numbers 150 and up but my a1c came back at 5.2 how’s that possible?

Hi thank you for accepting me, i was just diagnosed with type 2 diabetes today so Im looking for any advice on how i can reverse it. I know exercise is one thing that can help.
This is a condition that few type 2's are aware of but should be, so click on the picture to open the article and learn about it.
Hi all. My SO was just diagnosed with diabetes today. I'm trying to be as supportive as possible and helpful. Any tips or suggestions on what to expect/how to support him?

Starting once weekly ozempic. Experiences ? Thanks so much !!
Curious what everyone's go to for low BS. For me at the moment. Trying to stay healthy also, appreciate any and all tips.

help needed 🙆‍♀️.....i was diagnosed  t2d 2.5 years ago, diet controlled until lockdown,  first week on Metformin n scared what to eat. looking for low carb snacks. I used to have noodles or a slice of toast but can't now 😟.(have wm toast for breakfast) Protein snacks seem expensive. Did the Desmond course but was 1.5 years ago n forgot what to do now. Also getting  headaches all day and nausea 1/2 hour after meals.

With monsoons come humidity, sweating, stickiness and moisture, which encourage growth of fungus and moulds. These lead to secondary bacterial infections, causing skin damage and decay. Hence, people with diabetes should take special care of their feet during the monsoons.

As the old saying goes, ‘When fishermen can’t go to sea they repair their nets’... Why not to focus on the things you can control? On the things you didn’t have time for? On the things you avoided because you were too busy or had too much work or had other priorities?
